H0.description: The Hubble constant (km s-1 Mpc-1). [start, stop [, bins]] or single value
H0.label: $H_0$

Xi0.description: Parameter of the Xi0_n gravity model.
Xi0.label: $\Xi_0$

n.description: Parameter of the Xi0_n gravity model.
n.label: $H_0$

gamma.description: Powerlaw slope (PowerLaw), or low-z slope (Madau) for merger rate evolution with redshift.
gamma.label: $\gamma$

Madau_zp.description: Break-point for merger rate evolution with redshift (Madau).
Madau_zp.label: $z_p$

Madau_k.description: High-z slope for merger rate evolution with redshift (Madau).
Madau_k.label: $k$

mminbh.description: Minimum mass for BH mass distributions (solar masses).
mminbh.label: $M_{minBH}$

mmaxbh.description: Maximum mass for BH mass distributions (solar masses).
mmaxbh.label: $M_{maxBH}$

alpha.description: Slope of the primary powerlaw or powerlaw-gaussian BH mass distribution
alpha.label: $\alpha$

mu_g.description: Mean of the gaussian peak of the primary powerlaw-gaussian BH mass distribution.
mu_g.label: $\mu_g$

sigma_g.description: Width of the gaussian component of the primary powerlaw-gaussian BH mass distribution (solar masses).
sigma_g.label: $\sigma_g$

lambda_g.description: Relative weighting between the powerlaw and gaussian component of the primary powerlaw-gaussian BH mass distribution.
lambda_g.label: $\lambda_g$

alpha_1.description: Slope of the primary broken-powerlaw BH mass distribution before the break point.
alpha_1.label: $\alpha_1$

alpha_2.description: Slope of the primary broken-powerlaw BH mass distribution after the break point.
alpha_2.label: $\alpha_2$

b.description: Fraction of the way between mminbh and mmaxbh that the powerlaw break occurs in the primary broken-powerlaw BH mass distribution.
b.label: $b$

beta.description: Slope of secondary BH mass distribution.
beta.label: $\beta$

delta_m.description: Turn on of the minimum mass.
delta_m.label: $\delta_m$

mminns.description: Minimum mass for NS mass distributions (solar masses).
mminns.label: $M_{minNS}$

mmaxns.description: Maximum mass for NS mass distribution (solar masses).
mmaxns.label: $M_{maxNS}$

alphans.description: Slope of the powerlaw BNS mass distributions
alphans.label: $\alphans$
